Do you think the the #IPCC and #climate scientists' predictions of #GlobalWarming are far too conservative? Are they fearful of being too alarmist, when alarmed is precisely what we need to be? Always erring on the side of "least drama"?

"Over the past two decades, skeptics of the reality and significance of #anthropogenic climate change have frequently accused climate scientists of ‘‘alarmism’’: of over-interpreting or overreacting to evidence of human impacts on the climate system. However, the available evidence suggests that scientists have in fact been conservative in their projections of the impacts of climate change. In particular, we discuss recent studies showing that at least some of the key attributes of global warming from increased atmospheric greenhouse gases have been under-predicted, particularly in IPCC assessments of the physical science, by Working Group I. We also note the less frequent manifestation of over-prediction of key characteristics of climate in such assessments. We suggest, therefore, that scientists are biased not toward alarmism but rather the reverse: toward cautious estimates, where we define caution as erring on the side of less rather than more alarming predictions. We call this tendency ‘‘erring on the side of least drama (ESLD).’’
- Keynyn Brysse, Naomi Oreskes, Jessica O’Reilly, Michael Oppenheimer,
Climate change prediction: Erring on the side of least drama?,
Global Environmental Change,
Volume 23, Issue 1,
2013,
Pages 327-337,
ISSN 0959-3780,
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.gloenvcha.2012.10.008.

https://sci-hub.hkvisa.net/10.1016/j.gloenvcha.2012.10.008

#ClimateCrisis #AGW #AnthropogenicGlobalWarming #GlobalWarming #Climate #Klima #KlimaKrise #Erderwärmung

title: ASL Citizen: A Community-Sourced Dataset for Advancing Isolated Sign Language Recognition

last_post.content:
Our framing prompts ML practitioners to better ground claims about sign language model performance. Recognizing isolated signs out-of-context is not "solving" sign language translation. However, immediate use-cases of single-sign recognition can still benefit the Deaf community!

Check out the preprint here: https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.05934

And Aashaka's other research projects here: https://aashakadesai.github.io/research/

(Reposting for Aashaka Desai - aashakadesai.github.io - who isn't on the 'don)

Preprinting results on ASL Citizen: the first crowdsourced isolated sign language video dataset.

📹 ~84k videos, 2.7k signs, 52 signers
📈 ~2x improvement in recognition accuracy
🖋️ Partnership with Deaf community
📄http://arxiv.org/abs/2304.05934

title: Black Box Variational Inference with a Deterministic Objective: Faster, More Accurate, and Even More Black Box

last_post.content:
https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.05527
'Black Box Variational Inference with a Deterministic Objective: Faster, More Accurate, and Even More Black Box'
- Ryan Giordano, Martin Ingram, Tamara Broderick

The de facto approach to fitting general-purpose variational approximations to posterior distributions has been to either use closed-form updates (as in e.g. MFVI) or stochastic gradient methods (as in e.g. BBVI, ADVI). This work recalls an alternative to stochastic gradient methods, the sample average approximation (SAA), and demonstrates that as applied to fitting certain variational families, it can offer certain appealing advantages.

Introducing Conditional Adapters (CoDA) from Google Research!
Adaptation methods (e.g. Adapter and LoRA) can finetune LMs with minimal parameter updates, but their inference remains expensive. CoDA makes LMs faster to use, and works for three modalities!

Checkout our newest work: Self-Refine: Iterative Refinement with Self-Feedback

We show that LLMs such as GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 can:
1. Generate a draft output
2. Generate textual feedback critiquing it
3. Refine the draft output using the feedback
4. Iterate, as needed

Improves performance on 7 tasks including code and creative text generation. No supervised training, no RL, no human feedback!

Led by Aman Madaan
PDF: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.17651.pdf
Project page: https://selfrefine.info

title: SoK: On the Impossible Security of Very Large Foundation Models

last_post.content:
On the large AI models, this preprint synthesises what we know so far https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.15259

In short: it is mathematically impossible to have AIs combining the following properties:

1) High number of parameters
2) Robustness to poisoning (e.g. fake data)
3) Privacy-preserving
